title: US judge orders former Vice President Pence to testify in inquiry
description: US media reports that the ruling may compel Mike Pence to speak about Donald Trump's actions after the 2020 election.

title: Taiwan President Tsai’s controversial trip to Central America
description: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen is scheduled to depart on a 10-day tour of Central America with stopovers in the US.

title: US bid to ban TikTok raises hypocrisy charge amid global spying
description: Lawmakers' push to ban app comes as they mull extending powers that force tech firms to enable mass snooping for the US.

title: US announces sanctions against Assad cousins over drug trade
description: US Treasury officials say that the Assad government has used drug trafficking as a source of illicit revenue.

title: Senate committee questions federal regulators over US bank crisis
description: Tuesday marked the US Senate's first public hearing into the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank in early March.

title: For displaced Muslims in DRC, little food to break Ramadan fast
description: Some 500 Muslims displaced by the violence in eastern DR Congo have little water and food to break their Ramadan fast.

title: COVID-19: WHO says no extra booster needed for medium-risk adults
description: WHO recommends primary doses and a first booster in healthy adults, children and adolescents with comorbidities.

title: Murder conviction of Adnan Syed reinstated by appeals court panel
description: Syed, whose story was chronicled in the hit Serial podcast, had previously had his conviction vacated in September.

title: US bears ‘moral weight’ of Mexico migrant tragedy: Advocates
description: Ciudad Juarez blaze that killed at least 39 migrants comes amid increasingly restrictive policies at US-Mexico border.

title: Will Netanyahu be able to press ahead with his judicial overhaul?
description: Angry protests across Israel force Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to delay his government's controversial proposals.

title: One Mexican journalist attacked every 13 hours in 2022: Report
description: A report by the group Article 19 has documented nearly 700 crimes against media workers, the most on record.

title: US legislators voice concerns over Tunisia rights crackdown
description: Congress members say 'autocratic consolidation', treatment of migrants threatens US-Tunisia relations.

title: U-20 World Cup: Indonesia says no policy change in hosting Israel
description: Indonesia's president says Israel's participation in the Under-20 World Cup would bring no change to its foreign policy.

title: Israel’s parties to hold first talks on justice reforms
description: President Isaac Herzog has invited ruling parties and the opposition to meet Tuesday after judicial reforms were halted.

title: Portugal: Two women stabbed to death at Lisbon’s Islamic centre
description: Police say the attacker is in custody after he was shot and wounded for failing to put down his knife.

title: IOC recommends return of Russian, Belarusian athletes as neutrals
description: The Olympic committee has recommended that Russians and Belarusians be allowed to compete as neutrals.

title: Nashville police search for clues after latest US school shooting

title: Russian whose child drew anti-war image gets jail term but flees
description: Alexei Moskalyov's 13-year-old daughter has been placed in a children's home after making a drawing about Ukraine's war.

title: Ex-crypto boss Bankman-Fried charged with bribing China officials
description: US accuses founder of now-bankrupt FTX cryptocurrency exchange of conspiring to pay $40bn to Chinese officials.

title: Protests rage in France for a 10th day, as Macron remains defiant
description: Exit from the firestorm of protest triggered by Macron's changes looks as far away as ever.

title: Bitter taste of kiwis: Indian fruit pickers in Italy allege abuse
description: Many farmhands hail from the Punjab and migrate for better salaries than they would earn in India's breadbasket.

title: Myanmar military dissolves Aung San Suu Kyi’s NLD party
description: NLD led by Suu Kyi among 40 parties dissolved after failing to meet registration deadline, according to state TV.

title: Israelis need to see through the biggest lie of all
description: Israel cannot be a ‘Jewish state’ and a democracy, an occupier and a liberal society.

title: The Taliban needs to start an intra-Afghan dialogue but with who?

title: Photos: Fire kills dozens at Mexico migrant centre near US border

title: Pirates board Danish-owned ship in dreaded Gulf of Guinea
description: The tanker was attacked in the Gulf of Guinea, seen as one of the world's most dangerous shipping routes.

title: Bush did what Putin’s doing — so why is he getting away?

title: Philippines’ Marcos to shut out ICC after losing drug-war appeal

title: Israeli right-wing protesters attack Palestinians in Jerusalem
description: Reports say that one man was "savagely beaten" in Jerusalem, after pro-government supporters had gathered.

title: Israelis attack Palestinians in Huwara, despite army presence

title: Decades of deadly gun violence in US schools

title: Russia says oil sales to India soared 22-fold last year

title: Why does Russia want tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus?

title: UN says prominent Afghan girls’ education activist arrested

title: Freed Hotel Rwanda hero Rusesabagina arrives in Qatar from Rwanda
description: Rusesabagina was sentenced in September 2021 to 25 years over ties to a group opposed to Rwanda's Paul Kagame.

title: Tennis: Rafael Nadal unsure of comeback from injury

title: Despite inflation, Egyptians dig deep to give charity in Ramadan
description: An economic crisis means that many Egyptians will find it difficult to donate the amounts they usually do.

title: ‘Conflicting feeling’, says India’s first woman Rohingya graduate

title: Will ChatGPT take your job — and millions of others?

title: US Senate votes to advance repeal of Iraq War authorisation
